intro: Selatium multicaulis, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. Selatium multicaulis is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions.
